commit_message:
Add check for missing sequence in alignment records

– I am not yet completely sure what causes this but it may be a feature of minimap2.
Add reading contig name order from .fai
Fix paths, add rules for running samtools, use input from test workflow
Add initial version of example workflow
Use libboost package instead of boost-cpp
Use new API, add required member function
Include reference bias script in distribution
Add example local.mk for building statically linked binaries on Linux
Add "panvc3_" prefix to executables when building distribution .tar.gz
Fix storing chromosome and sequence identifiers in A2M input, add status logging
Add variable for Boost’s library directory
Add A2M input support, split code to multiple translation units
Add Linux on x86-64 to requirements, mention ldd --version
Add more detailed instructions for running workflow

Separate package names and versions by spaces

- Conda-build does not seem to handle the missing space properly when checking for dependencies, see https://github.com/conda/conda-build/issues/4130
Add library directory to linker flags
Use non-breaking spaces between program names and version numbers
Use non-breaking spaces between program names and version numbers
Move Testing to the beginning of the document
Fix handling invalid entries in sequence output order
Link libdispatch only when needed, produce debugging information for use by GDB
Update default compiler flags, allow setting compiler-specific flags in local.mk
Handle empty N position array in input
Avoid outputting empty array in SAM tag
Add option to output alignment match (M) operations
Add member function for swapping CIGAR buffer

Update usage

– Use the more common term.

Rename

– Use the more common term.

Add constructor for sequence_entry

- For some reason the compiler reported incompatible constructor parameters for the aggregate type.

Read sequence identifier separately from input

– Earlier the input file name was used as the sequence identifier.
Fix subprocess arguments when reading input from pipe
Fix position bit vector sizing when reading input from pipe
Output warnings conditionally if mate not found
Add option to filter by RNAME rather than prefix
Add sanity check to zygosity calculation
Add calculating box plot parameters for mapping quality

Change default tags

– BWA uses XA for listing alternative alignments.
Assign correct score for invalid records, improve debugging output
Handle next alignment having too low score

Rescore alignments using base qualities, take N characters into account

- The scoring algorithm is similar to that in Bowtie 2.
Add storing reference N character positions in SAM tag
Make options with default values optional
Store alignment score values in SAM tags

Rename alignment_scorer, bowtie2_v2_scorer

– The classes are used for calculating the mapping quality for a pair of alignments. The alignment score is another concept in SAM files.
Do not ignore supplementary alignments by default
Show source and destination in prompt in query mode
Add converting to sequence (not MSA) co-ordinates
Use more sensible duration unit in status output

Fix co-ordinate conversion for mate positions

– Chose the correct msa_index entries for the mate.
– Came up with a much more sensible solution for accessing the correct index entries.
Fix handling multiple entries with same program ID
Add option to filter by best mapping quality

Append program info to headers

– For some reason this got removed at some point.
Initialise header before accessing, output status periodically

Output time per realignment in microseconds

- Based on output this seems to be the most sensible option.
Append program info to SAM headers
Append program info to SAM headers
Add function for appending program info to SAM headers

Ignore runs with both paired and unpaired alignments, log number of records with mate missing from input alignments

– Handling reads with the same ID with both paired and unpaired alignments seems to be difficult (and also likely a corner case), so the current approach is to ignore them.
Fix mapping quality table lookup, fix ALIGNMENT_SCORE_MIN, fix clearing record buffer after processing, add debugging output
List options in more sensible order

Fix position output type, use constexpr where possible, use std::(lower|upper}_bound instead of ranges, fix compilation issues

– I was not able to get ranges::lower_bound or upper_bound to work with some std::vectors even after applying ranges::views::all. Fortunately the corresponding functions in std seem to work.
Fix position pair normalisation, MAPQ_NO_NEXT_RECORD’s type
Add tool for recalculating mapping qualities
Write to realigned ranges output only if needed

Add reading BAM input, output to path

– The latter is especially useful for debugging purposes, i.e. redirecting output to /dev/null.
Add taking status output interval from command line
Output mean realignment time in nanoseconds, output range length statistics

Move main() to its own compilation unit

- This solves the "terminate called without an active exception" problem as explained in the comments.
Prepare to move everything except main() to new compilation unit

Call process_input() asynchronously

- This helps in unmasking a bug that has to do with libdispatch; again the symptom was "terminate called without an active exception". My guess is that the compiler optimises the code in some way that interferes with the call of dispatch_main().
Use nodiscard where return value should not be ignored
Add callbacks for begin, end realignment
Add tags for original RNAME, POS, RNEXT

Disable memory logging, remove Bowtie's XS tag definition after all

- The memory logger still seems to have some bugs.
- Came up with a better idea to handle Bowtie's tags.

Preserve XS tag, disable filtering out non-primary alignments

- After projecting the alignments, their MAPQ values still need to be recalculated.
Move Markov chain generator to libbio
Move everything in namespace markov_chains to libbio
Fix joining adjacent matching CIGAR operations
Add option to specify output sequence order
Allow filtering by multiple RNAME prefixes
Store original PNEXT value in output
Use OA tag for original alignment instead of OC

Fix storing original alignment

- Obviously (?) this needs to be done after clearing the SAM tags, not before.
Fix handling ref_id_info in output headers
Fix type name, use assertion that requires printable value
Handle all chromosomes, read reference sequences from compressed file
Add class for storing sequence buffers
Add class for reading compressed FASTA

Disable multiprocessing

- For some reason the output is still malformed at times. Not processing the tasks in parallel seemed to alleviate the issue.

Use std::atomic to store index value for extra safety

- The semaphore should guarantee that the reads and writes are not re-ordered and that the same values are not accessed concurrently. On the other hand, the thread sanitiser reported some problems that may or may not have had to do with the index values.

Add (hidden) option to output PID

– This makes debugging easier; no need to run ps and possibly stop the process before that.
Clear alignment record before re-using, add assertions
Output re-aligned ranges in query co-ordinates in SAM/BAM

Remove erroneous safety check

- Deduplication does not actually guarantee non-overlapping re-aligned ranges (since e.g. two reads can be aligned to approximately the same position but different sequences).
Add option to output BAM, use SAM as default
Add re-aligned ranges to alignment output
Ensure that destructors are called on exit
Remove duplicate re-aligned ranges by default
Add (hidden) option to output debugging information
Add targets for building libbio’s tests

Fix opening re-aligned range output file

– Using swap on lb::file_ostream (a.k.a. Boost.Iostreams’s stream) caused problems at least in this case. Additionally some of the code was not correct.
Make alignment_projector data member of project_task

Update SeqAn

- A bugfix was needed but upgrading from version 3.2 requires more work. Additionally it is the latest tagged version.
Add option to output tool invocation
Add comparison functions for chromosome, sequence entries
Read reference names from headers by default, add option to check alignments
Output error message on missing reference ID
Add reading BAM input from stdin
Add reporting alignments by contig, const correctness
Move filtering alignments to new function
Set OC tag to original CIGAR
Assign projected CIGAR, preserve subset of SAM tags, report statistics

Allow linking libgcc statically

- Currently our environment has different versions of libgcc installed, some of which are too old.

Handle no mode given on command line

- Defaulting to building an index caused a segfault when no command line parameters were given.

Use macro available on Linux

- For some reason libdispatch does not have QOS_CLASS_USER_INITIATED on Linux.
Remove local settings from scripts in make directory
Remove local settings from scripts in make directory

Adjust DWARF version

– The system tools did not show all debugging information with DWARF-5 (macOS 12.6, Xcode 13.4.1).
Move types needed only by make_transition_map() from markov_chains::chain to namespace detail

Enable checking transition probability sum

– The previous check was not run since some code was missing. The updated version is simpler and is actually run.
Add test for indel_run_checker with arbitrary inputs
Produce Catch 2’s single include in top level makefile

Output debug information as DWARF 5

– This makes debugging easier on macOS.
Move utility functions to common header
Fix reporting CIGAR ranges, improve API
Add script for pretty-printing unit test input

Fix assigned character type

– Assigning a character from qualified_alphabet overwrote both the base (i.e. sequence character) and the quality.
Use new libbio API for parsing test input

Make SeqAn 3’s aligner report alignment

– For some reason specifying seqan3::align_cfg::output_alignment as part of the configuration caused the aligner not report the alignment.
Rewrite test such that inputs are read from separate file
Use named type for version number

Use seqan3::get instead of type cast to access tuple components

– This seems easier to understand when reading the code.
Add function for getting types from seqan3::type_list
Add tool for projecting alignments, given also two aligned sequences
Add function for projecting CIGAR sequences, given also two aligned sequences
Add class for checking for runs of indels in CIGAR sequences
Implement SPSC queue managed by dispatch_semaphore
Add helper function for calling SeqAn’s aligner
Implement functional mapping for std::tuple, mapping std::integer_sequence to std::tuple and std::array
Add function for making one sequence entry pair
Add classes and functions for handling CIGAR sequences
Prevent sam_file_output from using reference name stored in record
Read alignments from stdin, fix rewriting reference names
Add tool for filtering coverage positions by variants in VCF file
Add tool for calculating histogram of coverages
Add tool for merging two sets of coverages
Add tool for building subset of alignments

Fix coverage calculation

– All reference sequence positions need to be taken into account.
Output reference and alternative allele lengths separately

Take variants with reversed REF and ALT into account

- The field values are effectively reversed if PanVC removes a variant from the ad hoc reference but the variant caller finds it, or if combine_msa_vcf initially rewrites a variant in such a way that the REF field matches the ALT field.
Add tool for comparing two sets of supporting read counts

Add option to read reference names from alignment file

- This is useful mainly for debugging purposes.
Add script for calulating allelic balance from count_supporting_reads’s output

Anchor reads on both sides of variant by default

– For each read, the maximum position where both the reference and the query sequence have non-gap characters is now determined.
– By default, the aforementioned position is used to determine that the read is “anchored” also to the right side of the variant with which it overlaps. This way it can be determined that an insertion or deletion in the read is not just a prefix.
Handle more special cases, describe implemented algorithm

Remove unneeded assertion

– Since we use integer division, the assertion is not actually needed.

Add special character to indicate continued deletion

– When counting allelic balance, we would like to be able to differentiate deletions of the correct length from those of some other length.

Fix assertion

– The case where the reference subsequence is longer than the alternative was not taken into account in the earlier version.

Fix extracting aligned sequence from reads

– Some incorrect assumptions had been made in the previous algorithm.
Output debugging information in case assertion fails
Fix checking paired read contig name
Add calculating statistics from processing alignments
Move SAM/BAM reader specifics to helper functions
Add option to require that next alignment has same contig prefix
Add option to read BED from file in addition to stdin
Add option to use different chromosome identifiers for source and destination
Add options to load existing index, outputting its contents
Clarify option description, use British English
Add tool for converting BED file positions
Fix makefile paths, disable warnings per compiler
Add option to not output FASTA
Fix building libdispatch, build two versions of libbio
Add rank_0 support to MSA index
Remove duplicate code, add missing header, make it possible to output FASTA conditionally
Add reading SAM from stdin, decrease logging
Take clipping into account only when requested, fix position calculation, output ALTs

Rename

– The tool can currently compare either reference names or their prefixes.
Make comparing reference name equivalence default
Add tool for counting supporting reads for given variants
Add tool for splitting alignment file by reference name prefix
Add sample local.mk files for both GCC and LLVM
Add flags used specifically by SeqAn3
Modify compiler flags to make SeqAn3 compile
Add tool for generating indexable sequence
